UPDATE: The ethereum blockchain is running smoothly after activating the #Constantinople and #StPetersburg hard forks. 137 blocks have now been mined, with no evidence of a chain split.
The Ethereum chain has successfully forked and Constantinople is activated!

Ethereum’s #Constantinople + #StPetersburg hard forks are expected to activate in roughly one hour’s time. See our comprehensive overview on what to expect and how to follow along here:  https://t.co/e2rQjMlxTf
Over 70 blocks have been mined since the activation of ethereum upgrades #Constantinople and #StPetersburg at block 7,280,000, with no signs of a chain split. FULL STORY:  https://t.co/In3noAMXqe
Ethereum’s Constantinople and St. Petersburg upgrades have gone live  https://t.co/NHvvhXCwuI

JUST IN – After a series of delays and false starts, the ethereum blockchain appears to have officially activated a slew of new upgrades without incident:  https://t.co/In3noAMXqe @Christine_dkim reports #Constantinople #StPetersburg

The ethereum blockchain has just hit block number 7,280,000 – the  activation point for ethereum upgrades #Constantinople and #StPetersburg. According to EtherNodes, 19.8% of total Geth nodes on ethereum are running on the newly activated software.

Remember the #Constantinople network upgrade? It actually happened a little later than expected (block 7,280,000 rather than 7,080,000). We completed the upgrade alongside the #ETH network today. Don't worry, Wallet users do not need to take any action 🙌
